thread.title: Wednesday's local roundup: soccer, middle schools
thread.title_full: Wednesday's local roundup: soccer, middle schools

author: Staff reports
title: Wednesday's local roundup: soccer, middle schools
text: Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 10:06 PM Updated at 10:08 PM Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 10:06 PM Updated at 10:08 PM Varsity boys soccer Crest 3, Burns 1 — Zach Sandifer, Luke Patrick and George Odembo scored the goals as Crest improved to 8-5 in SMAC play (9-7 overall). Sandifer also supplied an assist for the Chargers. Daniel Hernendez scored for Burns with a penalty kick. Crest next travels to Shelby and Burns (4-9, 4-8) to R-S Central, both on Monday. Shelby 8, Draughn 4 — Noah Romich scored three goals to help the Golden Lions improve to 11-2 in SMAC play (12-2-1 overall). Tyler Cowan added two goals and three assists. Hayes Mabry, Steven Pate and Michael Allen also scored. Jay Wilson supplied two assists while Romich, Josh Price and Caleb Goss also had assists. Shelby hosts Crest on Monday. Kings Mountain 7, Cherryville 0 (Tuesday) — Josh Scism and Weston Harmon scored two goals apiece to lead the Mountaineers’ attack. Brian Lysek, Mason Nguyen and Nolan Raby also added goals. Raby supplied two assists, while Josia Schneider, Luke Rikard, Chase Yow, Riley Coleman and Holden Bullock had an assist each. Jarrett Ledford and John Harris split time in goal to record the shutout. JV football Shelby visits Ron Greene Stadium to take on Burns in junior varsity action Thursday. Kings Mountain will host R-S Central and Crest goes to East Burke in other games. Kickoff for each contest is at 7 p.m. Middle schools Softball Crest 15, Burns 0 (4 inns.) — Summer Deaton struck out five and allowed two hits to pick up the mound win for the Dragons. Abby Ramsey led the Crest attack with three hits, while Deaton, Kamryn Spangler and Eliza Warren had two hits apiece. Sydney Kale Mackenzie Hayes and Maliyah Meeks also hit safely for the Dragons. Golf Kings Mountain 160, Rutherford County 171, Crest 213 — The Patriots recorded a season-low team score to record their fourth win of the season. Brady Waters led Kings Mountain with a 37. Nicholas Stewart (40), Vince Mann (43), Tucker Leatherman (46) and Beau Kue (52) also recorded scores. Rutherford’s Austin Alexander shot 33 to claim individual medalist honors. The Patriots return to action Tuesday at the River Bend YMCA Golf Course for the Cleveland County championship match. City Park flag football Panthers 32, Falcons 6 — Key'non Surratt had touchdown runs of 30, 34, 34 and 29 yards with JaCari Martin adding two conversions for the victors. Jaharie Linder contributed a 30-yard scoring run for the Panthers. Dontae Adams had a 14-yard touchdown run for the Falcons. Cowboys 25, Raiders 6 — Immanuel Collins had scoring runs of 45 and 30 yards with Chance Young adding a 29-yard touchdown dash for the Cowboys. Tyler Morgan provided a 30-yard touchdown run and Camden Lutz supplied a conversion for the victors. Page 2 of 2 - Tabian Collins had an 11-yard touchdown run for the Raiders. Cowboys 34, Titans 0 — Emmanuel Collins had a 30-yard scoring run and two conversions for the Cowboys, who also got a 20-yard touchdown run and conversion by Chance Young. Tyler Morgan added scoring runs of 30 and 10 yards with a conversion for the victors. Jacob Littlejohn completed the scoring with a 30-yard run. Raiders 26, Falcons 25 — Jahari Roberts had touchdown runs of 10 and 13 yards plus a conversion for the Raiders. Carter Glenn added a touchdown run of 12 yards and a conversion with Aaron Biggers supplying a 10-yard touchdown for the victors. Kamri Wray had touchdown runs of 10, 15, 20 and 30 yards for the Falcons with Willie Wilson adding a conversion. By Staff reports
